episodes.title: Ruby Franke’s Ex Slams Partner-in-Crime in Bombshell Lawsuit
episodes.description: Kevin Franke recently filed a lawsuit against Jodi Hildebrandt in Utah court. Hildebrandt was convicted of child abuse alongside Franke’s wife Ruby and sentenced to prison. episodes.title: ‘Man of God’ and Wife Accused of Locking Boy in Shed for Months
episodes.description:
A Pennsylvania couple is facing felony child endangerment charges after allegedly forcing a young boy to live for months in a backyard shed without plumbing, access to regular food, or basic hygiene. Police say the child was exiled for “inappropriate behavior,” made to drink from a garden hose, use leaves instead of toilet paper, and pay for his own food — until he finally refused to return to the shed, prompting a violent confrontation with the man, a self-described bishop. Daryl, a bishop, and Grace Sensenig were arrested following the incident and released on bail, while the child is now in the care of extended family. Law&Crime's Kennedi Walker has the horrifying details.

episodes.title: P. Diddy Pardon? Defense Fights for Freedom as President Considers Clemency
episodes.description: Sean “Diddy” Combs was convicted on two federal prostitution charges, but now there are reports that President Donald Trump could be considering a pardon for the rapper. This comes as Combs’ defense team demands the judge overrule the jury’s decision ahead of sentencing. Law&Crime’s Jesse Weber breaks down the bombshell development, the defense team’s push for a new trial, and what it all means for Diddy’s future with celebrity criminal defense attorney Bradford Cohen. Vallow now faces sentencing for these Arizona convictions.

episodes.title: P. Diddy Seeks Therapy and Rehab Behind Bars: Report
episodes.description:
Sean “Diddy” Combs, though acquitted of the most serious charges like RICO conspiracy and sex trafficking, remains in custody awaiting sentencing on lesser charges, with his history of domestic violence and drug abuse most likely playing a central role in the judge’s decision to deny bail. Now reportedly enrolled in therapy and rehab programs inside MDC Brooklyn — including one aimed at preventing sexual and domestic violence — Combs appears to be pursuing self-reform, though skeptics question whether it’s genuine growth or a strategic move to impress the judge before his October 3rd sentencing. Law&Crime’s Elizabeth Millner breaks it all down.

episodes.description:

episodes.title: Twin Flames ‘Cult’ Under Fire from the Feds
episodes.description: An online spiritual community known as “Twin Flames Universe” is under scrutiny following allegations of coercion, financial exploitation, and identity manipulation. episodes.title: Diddy Trial AI: 'Jane' Testifies On Alleged Sex Abuse in Rapper's Federal Trial — Part Two
episodes.description:
Jane, who goes under a pseudonym, testified in Sean "Diddy" Combs' federal trial for six days. She is identified as "victim-2" in court documents. Jane detailed her years-long relationship with Diddy, which began in 2020 and continued until he was indicted on federal charges of sex trafficking and racketeering conspiracy. Law&Crime produced Jane's testimony from June 5 using AI-generated content based on real court transcripts from the Diddy trial due to cameras being banned in federal court. Subscribe to watch all AI recreations of the Diddy trial and stay tuned for more testimony.

Produced by: Lamont Belton
Voice Acting by: Sierra Gillespie, Bobby Szoke

The following video was produced by Law&Crime with AI-generated content using real court transcripts from the Sean Combs trial. All of the audio and visuals were recreated using AI to simulate the trial proceedings in the courtroom. Precise body movements, expressions, hand movements, and vocal intonations have been presented by AI, but do not exactly mirror what physical movements transpired in the courtroom. Certain individuals shown, such as jurors and attendees in the gallery, are made of composite characters and do not represent the likeness or appearance of those individuals in real life. This is an ongoing trial. Sean “Diddy” Combs is presumed innocent unless proven guilty.

episodes.title: Teens Vanish After FLDS Religious Brainwashing: Mother
episodes.description:
Two teenage siblings, 15-year-old Rachelle Fischer and 13-year-old Allen Fischer, vanished from their Idaho home, triggering an Amber Alert amid fears they were taken by their older sister to rejoin the polygamist FLDS religious sect. Their mother, who left the FLDS five years ago, believes her missing 18-year-old daughter and ex-husband may have orchestrated the children’s disappearance. Authorities are actively searching across state lines, particularly in Utah, and warn the children may be in grave danger. Law&Crime’s Chris Stewart has the facts of this report on this episode of On the Case.

episodes.title: Baby Died After Parents Chose to Pray Instead of Getting Life-Saving Care
episodes.description:
A deeply religious Michigan couple, Joshua and Rachel Piland, were sentenced to at least 20 years in prison after allowing their newborn daughter, Abigail, to die from untreated jaundice — a curable condition — because they chose prayer over medical care. Despite warnings from a midwife and Rachel’s mother, the couple refused to take the baby to the hospital, citing their faith and belief that “God makes no mistakes.” Law&Crime’s Chris Stewart has more details on this episode of On the Case.

episodes.description:
The woman identified as "victim-4" in court documents took the stand and testified in Sean "Diddy" Combs' federal trial on May 29. Mia, which is a pseudonym, was a former assistant of Diddy when he dated Cassie Ventura. Law&Crime produced Mia's testimony using AI-generated content based on real court transcripts from the Diddy trial due to cameras being banned in federal court. Subscribe to watch all AI recreations of the Diddy trial and stay tuned for more testimony.

Produced by: Lamont Belton
Voice Acting by: Sierra Gillespie, Bobby Szoke

The following video was produced by Law&Crime with AI-generated content using real court transcripts from the Sean Combs trial. All of the audio and visuals were recreated using AI to simulate the trial proceedings in the courtroom. Precise body movements, expressions, hand movements, and vocal intonations have been presented by AI, but do not exactly mirror what physical movements transpired in the courtroom. Certain individuals shown, such as jurors and attendees in the gallery, are made of composite characters and do not represent the likeness or appearance of those individuals in real life. This is an ongoing trial. Sean “Diddy” Combs is presumed innocent unless proven guilty.

episodes.title: P. Diddy Assistant Claims Rape, Control and Terror Behind the Fame
episodes.description:
In a major development in the Sean “Diddy” Combs trial, a former assistant known as “Mia” testified, backing Cassie Ventura’s abuse claims while revealing her own allegations of sexual assault, control, and humiliation by Combs during her eight years of employment. Mia described multiple disturbing incidents, including being drugged and raped, fearing for Cassie’s life during violent episodes, and being manipulated into silence under the threat of professional ruin. Her powerful testimony mirrored Cassie’s, as both women described a pattern of abuse by Combs, who denies all allegations. Law&Crime’s Kennedi Walker analyzes the similarities between the two testimonies.

episodes.title: Diddy Trial AI: Cassie Ventura Testifies About 'Freak Offs' in Sex Trafficking Trial — Part Two
episodes.description:
Sean “Diddy” Combs’ ex-girlfriend, identified by the feds as “Victim-1,” took the stand in the famed music mogul’s trial on May 14 and continued testifying under direct examination. Casandra “Cassie” Ventura detailed the infamous "freak offs," giving never-before-heard information about what went on behind closed doors. Cassie was on the stand for four days, giving her side of the story during direct examination before being questioned by Diddy’s attorney. Law&Crime produced Cassie Ventura’s testimony using AI-generated content based on real court transcripts due to cameras being banned in federal court. Subscribe to watch all AI recreations of the Diddy trial and stay tuned for part three of Ventura’s testimony.

Produced by: Lamont Belton
Voice Acting by: Sierra Gillespie, Bobby Szoke

The following video was produced by Law&Crime with AI-generated content using real court transcripts from the Sean Combs trial. All of the audio and visuals were recreated using AI to simulate the trial proceedings in the courtroom. Precise body movements, expressions, hand movements, and vocal intonations have been presented by AI, but do not exactly mirror what physical movements transpired in the courtroom. Certain individuals shown, such as jurors and attendees in the gallery, are made of composite characters and do not represent the likeness or appearance of those individuals in real life. This is an ongoing trial. Sean “Diddy” Combs is presumed innocent unless proven guilty.

episodes.title: Diddy Trial AI: Cassie Ventura Testifies in Sex Trafficking Trial — Part One
episodes.description:
Sean “Diddy” Combs’ ex-girlfriend, identified by the feds as “Victim-1,” took the stand and testified in the famed music mogul’s trial on May 13. Casandra “Cassie” Ventura detailed how she got involved with Diddy and when their relationship took a shocking turn. Cassie was on the stand for four days, giving her side of the story during direct examination before being questioned by Diddy’s attorney. Law&Crime produced Cassie Ventura’s testimony using AI-generated content based on real court transcripts due to cameras being banned in federal court. Subscribe to watch all AI recreations of the Diddy trial and stay tuned for part two of Ventura’s testimony.

Produced by: Lamont Belton
Voice Acting by: Sierra Gillespie, Bobby Szoke

The following video was produced by Law&Crime with AI-generated content using real court transcripts from the Sean Combs trial. All of the audio and visuals were recreated using AI to simulate the trial proceedings in the courtroom. Precise body movements, expressions, hand movements, and vocal intonations have been presented by AI, but do not exactly mirror what physical movements transpired in the courtroom. Certain individuals shown, such as jurors and attendees in the gallery, are made of composite characters and do not represent the likeness or appearance of those individuals in real life. This is an ongoing trial. Sean “Diddy” Combs is presumed innocent unless proven guilty.

episodes.description:
As the prosecution’s star witness wrapped up her testimony against disgraced music mogul Sean “Diddy” Combs, a central question has been raised: why did Casandra Ventura continue dating Combs when she alleges he was abusing her? episodes.title: Brian Ross Investigates —  Exclusive Interview with LLDM Church Leader's “Sex Slave”
episodes.description:
This week on Brian Ross Investigates, an exclusive interview with a young woman who says she was coerced into becoming a sex slave for the leader of a worldwide church that claims five million members in the United States and 50 other countries around the world.

In going public, Sochil Martin is the first of scores of young women who prosecutors say were victims of Naason Joaquin Garcia, the self-proclaimed Apostle of the Light of the World Church.

Garcia is awaiting trial in Los Angeles and has pleaded not guilty to sex trafficking charges.  California prosecutors say Garcia used his position in the church “to satisfy a seemingly insatiable appetite for sex with young girls and boys.”
